thread.title: Heena Parmar: I used to play dandiya until my feet fall off
thread.title_full: Heena Parmar: I used to play dandiya until my feet fall off - The Times of India

author: Neha Maheshwri
title: Heena Parmar: I used to play dandiya until my feet fall off
text:
Heena Parmar, who is currently seen in 'Bharat Ka Veer Putra â€” Maharana Pratap' as Phool Kanwar hails from Surendranagar, Gujarat. Being a Gujarati, the pretty actress feels dandiya is in her blood.
"I can't stop myself from swirling once I get dandiya sticks. I wish I could get time off from shooting to play dandiya," quips Heena.
READ: Heena Parmar to play Anarkali in Jodha Akbar
The actress, who earlier played the role of Anarkali in 'Jodha Akbar' while sharing some special memories associated with the festival said, "Like any Gujarati, Navratri is always very special to me. When I was in the hometown, I used to celebrate this festival with much pomp and fanfare.
A special pooja was performed for 9 days and we used to play dandiya until our feet fall off. But now as I am Mumbai, so I am going to miss it."
Read Heena Parmar is Salim's Anarkali . You might also want to read when Heena befriended a horse on the sets of Maharana Pratap .
